title: Radiohead announce new album and world tour
content: Radiohead news includes the band forming a new business entity, RHEUK25 LLP, which has fueled speculation about a potential return to music or touring. Now the internet is exploding: Radiohead is releasing the succesor of "Moon Shaped Pool" (2016).
author: Radiohead

title: Wilco live at Best Kept Secret 2025
content: Wilco played last Sunday on stage ONE of Best Kept Secret. MIE was there too tell you the story.
author: Wilco

title: The Bends | Radiohead

author: Thom Yorke

title: Moon Shaped Pool | Radiohead
content: Radioheads ninth studio album, A Moon Shaped Pool, released in 2016, stands as a poignant exploration of emotional depth and sonic experimentation. The album’s orchestral arrangements, crafted by Jonny Greenwood and performed by the London Contemporary Orchestra, infuse the tracks with a haunting beauty. Songs like “Burn the Witch” and “Daydreaming” showcase the band’s ability to blend electronic elements with classical instrumentation, creating a soundscape that is both innovative and deeply affecting. Critics have noted the albums introspective nature, with lyrics delving into themes of love, loss, and societal critique. The closing track, “True Love Waits,” is particularly notable for its minimalist piano arrangement, providing a stark and moving conclusion to the album. While some reviews, such as one from Indiestyle, suggest that the album marks a return to familiar territory for Radiohead, potentially lacking the groundbreaking innovation of previous works,  others, like Dansende Beren, have lauded it as one of the best albums of the decade.  This divergence in opinion underscores the album’s complex reception, reflecting its layered composition and emotional resonance. Overall, A Moon Shaped Pool is a testament to Radiohead’s enduring ability to craft music that is both sonically adventurous and emotionally profound, solidifying their place in the pantheon of modern music.
author: Thom Yorke
